turns.content:
I have found several results for a one-week high protein vegan meal plan filled with healthy plant-based recipes for breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks. Here is a summary of the different sources and their suggested meal plans:

1. Abbey's Kitchen: Abbey's Kitchen offers a one-week vegan meal plan that includes high protein vegan foods like beans, legumes, nuts, seeds, tofu, hemp seeds, chia, and nutritional yeast [1].
2. Eating Well: Eating Well provides a seven-day high protein vegan meal plan with daily totals of 1,214 calories, 56 g protein, 132 g carbohydrate, 30 g fiber, 53 g fat, 7 g saturated fat, and 1,845 mg sodium. They also offer suggestions on how to modify the plan for higher calorie intake [2].
3. Running on Real Food: Running on Real Food shares a one-week vegan meal plan that includes breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snack ideas like avocado toast, almond butter and jam toast, lentil soup, and vegan protein shake [3].
4. Vegan.io: Vegan.io offers a vegan meal plan packed with protein that includes high protein sources like edamame, tempeh, and hemp seeds. They also suggest the use of protein powder as a supplement [4].
5. Trifecta Nutrition: Trifecta Nutrition provides a vegan meal prep recipe toolkit with high protein vegan recipes like chickpea artichoke tuna-salad, jackfruit tacos, and quinoa stuffed bell peppers [5].
6. Healthline: Healthline shares a sample vegan meal plan with high protein foods like tofu, lentils, quinoa, and almonds. They also offer suggestions on how to modify the plan for higher or lower calorie intake [6].
7. Minimalist Baker: Minimalist Baker offers 14 high protein plant-based dishes that include a flavorful tofu stir-fry, a dark chocolate energy bite, and a vegan lentil shepherd's pie [7].
8. Emilie Eats: Emilie Eats provides a list of high protein vegan dinners, including black bean Buddha bowl with avocado pesto, cajun-style red beans and rice, and peanutty quinoa bowls [8].
9. VeganFitGuide: VeganFitGuide offers high protein vegan meal ideas like creamy white bean chili, creamy red pepper protein pasta, and vegan quinoa and black bean bowls [9].
10. Whole Foods Market: Whole Foods Market provides a 7-day vegan meal plan with plant-based recipes like vegetable fried rice, roasted vegetable quinoa salad, and portobello fajitas [10].

Overall, these sources offer a variety of high protein vegan meal plans and recipes to choose from, allowing you to find the ones that suit your taste preferences and nutritional needs.

[2] "Day 6 Snack: Chewy Honey Granola Bars. Theres sweetness from the honey, chewiness from the raisins, hints of chocolate and cinnamon, and a bit of crunch. To save a few for later, wrap individual bars and place in a resealable freezer container. When you want a satisfying treat on short notice, just grab one and let it thaw for a few minutes."

[4] "7. A Week of Easy Plant-Based Dinners Packed with Protein. Its a common misconception that its not always easy to get your fill of protein if youre eating meatless. Lunch- 2 servings of bell peppers and hummus snack with 2 servings of peanut butter and celery. Dinner- 2 servings of blueberry almond butter oatmeal with 1 serving of microwaved sweet potato."
URL: https://www.dietsmealplan.com/meal-plan/on-a-budget/vegetarian-meal-plan-on-budget/

[8] "Vegetarian Spaghetti Squash Lasagna. $2.91 per serving. Budget Tip: Going meatless a few times a week is good for your health, good for your wallet and good for the environment. URL: https://www.eatingwell.com/article/126017/7-day-budget-meal-plan-shopping-list/

Add one or two eggs for an increase in protein, or for a vegan version, mash white beans into the avocado. Add cheese crumbles, chopped nuts or seeds, baby greens, or cherry tomatoes as garnishes. 3."

Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given query. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Query: low budget vegetarian 7 day meal plan breakfast , lunch and dinner including snacks diabetes friendly

After conducting a web search, I found several results for a low budget vegetarian 7 day meal plan including breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks that are diabetes-friendly. Here is a sample meal plan that includes recipe ideas from various sources:

Day 1:

* Breakfast: Avocado toast with a poached egg [[9](https://thesuperhealthyfood.com/breakfast-lunch-and-dinner-meal-plan-for-a-week/)]
* Snack: Carrots and hummus
* Lunch: Slow cooker creamy lentil soup with cannellini beans [[1](https://www.eatingwell.com/article/291342/7-day-clean-eating-vegetarian-meal-plan-to-lose-weight-1200-calories/)]
* Snack: Greek yogurt with berries
* Dinner: Vegetarian spaghetti squash lasagna [[8](https://www.eatingwell.com/article/126017/7-day-budget-meal-plan-shopping-list/)]

Day 2:

* Breakfast: Banana oatmeal pancakes [[3](https://www.cooksmarts.com/articles/free-budget-meal-plan/)]
* Snack: Apple slices with almond butter
* Lunch: Meal prep noodle soup jars [[6](https://www.budgetbytes.com/category/recipes/vegetarian/)]
* Snack: Roasted chickpeas
* Dinner: Chickpea stew [[4](https://www.thekitchn.com/our-10-best-vegetarian-meal-plans-23048927)]

Day 3:

* Breakfast: Customizable breakfast sandwich [[3](https://www.cooksmarts.com/articles/free-budget-meal-plan/)]
* Snack: Hard-boiled egg
* Lunch: Sweet potato, hummus, and peanut butter snack [[7](https://www.dietsmealplan.com/meal-plan/on-a-budget/vegetarian-meal-plan-on-budget/)]
* Snack: String cheese and grapes
* Dinner: Falafel-spiced tofu with roasted vegetables [[4](https://www.thekitchn.com/our-10-best-vegetarian-meal-plans-23048927)]

Day 4:

* Breakfast: Blueberry almond butter oatmeal [[7](https://www.dietsmealplan.com/meal-plan/on-a-budget/vegetarian-meal-plan-on-budget/)]
* Snack: Cottage cheese with sliced peaches
* Lunch: Leftover falafel-spiced tofu with roasted vegetables [[4](https://www.thekitchn.com/our-10-best-vegetarian-meal-plans-23048927)]
* Snack: Trail mix
* Dinner: Vegetarian green curry with brown rice [[4](https://www.thekitchn.com/our-10-best-vegetarian-meal-plans-23048927)]

Day 5:

* Breakfast: Overnight oats with chia seeds and berries [[3](https://www.cooksmarts.com/articles/free-budget-meal-plan/)]
* Snack: Edamame
* Lunch: Leftover vegetarian green curry with brown rice [[4](https://www.thekitchn.com/our-10-best-vegetarian-meal-plans-23048927)]
* Snack: Yogurt with mixed nuts
* Dinner: Spinach and feta stuffed portobello mushrooms [[10](https://www.healthline.com/nutrition/easy-healthy-meals)]

Day 6:

* Breakfast: Homemade granola with almond milk [[2](https://www.tasteofhome.com/collection/vegetarian-meal-plan/)]
* Snack: Cherry tomatoes with mozzarella cheese
* Lunch: Leftover slow cooker creamy lentil soup with cannellini beans [[1](<https://www.eatingwell.com/article/>
